intro: Ferula loscosii, commonly known as the Afghan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Ferula loscosii is also noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
